jqx_About.description:
This module was inspired by the idea that some JQuery was too good to ditch.
It is developed in a modular fashion and uses plain ES20xx, so not really (or really not, take your pick) suitable for older browsers.
The module originally was written in 2021. In 2023 it was rewritten in a classfree object oriented fashion, inspired by a Douglas Crockford presentation. This means you will very seldom find this in the code.
It is not a replacement for JQuery. Consider it a subset of JQuery alike methods to retrieve, create, modify or manipulate (collections of) HTML elements in your HTML document.
This document is completely built using JQx. Another example/demo-version can be found @https://kooiinc.codeberg.page/JQx/Resource/Demo.
In the following you'll find documentation for usage of the module, divided into 4 chapters:
  • STATIC
    : static methods/properties of the JQx module;
  • INSTANCE
    : all methods/properties applicable to a JQx instance;
  • POPUP
    : JQx includes a module to create (modal) popup messages;
  • DEBUGLOG
    : JQx includes a module to extensively log everything it does (you do with it).

JQx instance creation/retrieval

Note: For this document JQx is imported as $ (so (the result of) import $ from "[location of JQx]"). Most examples in the following use this.
JQx provides a single Function/Object to create and/or retrieve HTML elements and convert the result to a JQx instance. A JQx instance contains a collection of the created or retrieved HTML element(s). These element(s) can be manipulated extensively.
Element creation or retrieval using the imported JQx-function always results in a JQx instance.
The syntax is (JQx imported as $)
  • $(html: string | string[][, root: HTMLElement | JQx instance, position: string])
    Creates element(s) from a single HTML string or an Array of HTML strings. Using an Array of HTML strings creates the elements subsequently. The created element(s) is/are appended to root (default document.body) at position (default: as the last element of root).
  • $(cssSelector: string[, root: HTMLElement | JQx instance])
    Retrieves all Elements from the document using cssSelector (e.g. `div.example, h3#someId`) within root (default document).
  • $(element: Node | Node[])
    Takes the given element(s) and creates a JQx instance from it/them.
Most examples in this document can be run (use the [Try it] button). If elements are created/modified in an example, the result is shown within the item at hand (and removed after a few seconds) or in a popup.
Note: The examples in this document deliberately use all kinds of JQx methods, to familiarize you with them.

instance_text.description:
Set the textcontent of all elements of the instance element collection.
When textValue is empty, returns the current textcontent of the first element of the instance element collection. Otherwise returns the JQx Instance.

instance_each.description:
Loops through every element of the instance collection and applies the given callback function to it.
The signature of the callback function is (element, [i]) => {...}. Elements that are not HTMLElement (e.g. Comment or text nodes) are not processed.
Click the [Try it] button twice and watch the method name headers for a demo.
##EXAMPLECODE@eachEx##

params.cb: Function. The lambda function to appy to every element of the collection.

instance_remove.description:
Removes every element of the instance element collection, or, when selector is present, removes every child element from of the instance element collection for which the selector applies.
$(`p`).remove(); // => all <p> are removed from the document $(`p`).remove(".toBeRemoved"); // => all <p.toBeRemoved> are removed from the document $(`p`).remove(":not(.keepMe)"); // => all <p> except "<p.keepMe>" are removed from the document

params.selector: string. A (valid) css selector string, e.g. #someDiv.someClass

instance_computedStyle.description:
Retrieves the computed style for the given property the first element of the instance collection.
See also
Style.computed
.
##EXAMPLECODE@computedStyleEx##

instance_isEmpty.description:
returns: true if the JQx Instance collection is empty, otherwise false.
Note: alternatively you can use [JQx instance].is.empty.
##EXAMPLECODE@isEmptyEx##

instance_getData.description:
Retrieve the value of a data-attribute. When valueWhenFalsy is present, it will return that value if the data-attribute does not exist.
See also:
data
.
##EXAMPLECODE@getDataEx##

params.dataAttribute: string. The data-attribute to query, e.q. width

params.valueWhenFalsy: Any. The value to return when the data-attribute was not found.

instance_is.description:
[JQx instance].is is a static property. To retrieve a value of it use [JQx instance].is[key]. If the JQx instance element collection is empty, the return values of all properties except empty will be "n/a".
[JQx instance].is keys:
  • writable: is the first element of the JQx instance collection writable?
  • visible: is the first element of the JQx instance collection visible in the DOM?
  • disabled: is the first element of the JQx instance collection disabled?
  • open: is the first element of the JQx instance collection open (<details> or <dialog>)
  • modal: is the first element of the JQx instance collection modal (<dialog>)
  • empty: is the JQx instance element collection empty?
  • virtual: does the JQx instance only exist in memory?
##EXAMPLECODE@isEx##

instance_hasClass.description:
For (the list of) className(s) determine if the first (root) element of the JQx Instance element collection contains (one of) the classNames.
##EXAMPLECODE@hasClassEx##

instance_replace.description:
Replace [oldChild] (a DOM Element, css selector or a JQx instance) within the first (root) element of the instance element collection with a new JQx Instance
##EXAMPLECODE@replaceEx##

params.oldChild: JQx instance | HTMLElement | String. If String, a (valid) css selector.

instance_toDOM.description:
Add a 'virtual' element (an element created in memory, using the [instance].virtual or the [JQx constructor][tagName] method) to the DOM.
Defaults to adding the element to the body, but root may be any element (if the DOM allows it). See
virtual
documentation for an example.

instance_first.description:
Returns the first element of the JQx element collection or a new JQx Instance derived from the first element of the JQx Instance element collection. When asJQxInstance is true, the element is returned as a new JQx Instance (equivalent to
first$
), otherwise a DOM Node.
##EXAMPLECODE@firstEx##

instance_append.description:
Appends one ore more elements to each element of the JQx Instance collection (for real, in the DOM tree).
Notes:
  • when the JQx Instance to append to is empty, nothing will happen.
  • If (one of) elems2Append consists of html string(s), they should contain valid html (e.g., no flow content in elements expecting phrasing content, so for example no <h1> within <p>). The HTML is always sanitized.
  • Already existing (in DOM) elems2Append are moved to the JQx instance when the JQx instance to append to has one element in its collection, but
  • elems2Append (if JQx instance or Node) are cloned and stripped of their id when the JQx instance collection to append to contains more then one element.
##EXAMPLECODE@appendEx##

params....elems2Append: string[] | HTMLElement[]| Text[] | Comment[] | JQx instance[]

instance_appendTo.description:
Appends the collection of one JQx instance to another instance, so injects the element(s) of [JQx instance element collection] to each element of appendTo (for real, injected and visible in the DOM tree).
Note: this returns appendTo (so, the parent JQx Instance).
##EXAMPLECODE@appendToEx##

static_delegate.description:
Create targeted event listeners/handlers.
Note: non bubbling events are delegated using {capture: true}. This concerns the following events:
  • load
  • unload
  • scroll
  • focus
  • blur
  • DOMNodeRemovedFromDocument
  • DOMNodeInsertedIntoDocument
  • loadstart
  • progress
  • error
  • abort
  • load
  • loadend
  • pointerenter
  • pointerleave
  • readystatechange
The example creates a click listener/handler for the header of this chapter ("[JQx].delegate"). The handler changes the color of all headers (by changing the value of the corresponding variable within :root). It is a specific click handler for this header only (but all headers are affected: so click on the header '[JQx].delegate' changes the color of all headers, clicking on another header handles the already defined click handler (scroll to it)).
##EXAMPLECODE@staticDelegateEx##

params.type: string. Event type (e.g. click) to listen for

params.origin: string. Optional selector to identify the element to assign listener to (e.g. #someId)

instance_dimensions.description:
Retrieve the actual dimensions of the first (root) element in the instance element collection. It actually returns the result of getBoundingClientRect, see MDN for interpretation of the values.
Note: dimensions is a property, not a function. Usage [JQx instance].dimensions.
##EXAMPLECODE@dimEx##

instance_duplicate.description:
Duplicate a JQx instance to memory (default) or to DOM (append to root).
The elements within the instance are cloned, their id's are removed and the resulting NodeList is converted to a new JQx Instance.
Note: check the cloned nodes classList/properties/attributes: you may want to change them before injecting to DOM.
##EXAMPLECODE@duplicateEx##

instance_css.description:
Style each element of the element collection of the JQx Instance within the custom style sheet (<style id="JQxStylesheet">), using an intermediate (generated, random) or given class name. Preferably use key-value pairs, even when assigning a single property.
Notes
  • the intermediate className starts with "jQxClass-". There will be one intermediate class name per element. Subsequent .css calls will modify the rule for the generated class name.
  • using !important will be honored, e.g. {color: `green !important`}
##EXAMPLECODE@cssEx##
See also [JQx instance].Style.inSheet

params.keyOrKvPairs: Object | string. If you want to use a className for the css, add a className property to the Object.

params.value: string | undefined. If value is a string, keyOrKvPairs must be a string too.

instance_empty.description:
Remove contents for all elements of the JQx instance element collection.
Equivalent to
clear
instance_empty.returnValue: JQx Instance. An instance with elements without any content.

instance_clear.description:
Remove contents for all elements of the JQx instance element collection.
##EXAMPLECODE@clearEx##

instance_hide.description:
Hide each element of the element collection of the JQx instance.
Note: hiding changes the css display property to "none". It may be more useful to use a css class for this.
##EXAMPLECODE@showHideEx##

instance_removeAttribute.description: Remove some attribute from each element of the element collection of the JQx Instance.

instance_removeClass.description:
Remove classNames from for each element of the element collection of the JQx Instance. Class names can be one or more strings.
##EXAMPLECODE@removeClassEx##

instance_replaceClass.description:
Swap className with nwClassnames for each element of the element collection of the JQx Instance. Enables replacing a class name with one or more class name(s)
##EXAMPLECODE@replaceClassEx##

params....nwClassNames: string[]. The class name(s) to replace className with.

instance_find.description:
Find one or more elements within the first (root) element of the JQx Instance collection using a css query (e.g. '.someClass').
##EXAMPLECODE@findEx##

instance_find$.description:
Find one or more elements within the JQx Instance collection using a css query (e.g. '.someClass') starting from the root element of the collection, and return a new JQx Instance from it's result
##EXAMPLECODE@find$Ex##

params.indexOrSelector: Number | string. If string, a (valid) css selector.

instance_on.description:
Add listener and handler lambda('s) for the JQx Instance root element.
The lambda signature is [handler function](event, JQxInstance).
See
the toggleClass documentation
for examplary usage.

params....callback: Function[]. One or more handler functions (lambda's)

instance_outerHtml.description:
Retrieves the complete html for the first (root) element of the JQx Instance.
Note: .outerHtml is a property (not a method). It is also possible to use the HTML for this: [instance].HTML.get(true). See:
[JQx instance].HTML
##EXAMPLECODE@outerHTMLEx##

instance_parent.description:
Get the direct parentNode of the first (root) element of the JQx Instance (as new JQx Instance).
Notes:
  • .parent is a property (not a method)
  • In (the unlikely) case there is no parent, .parent returns the original JQx instance.

instance_html.description:
Get (inner-) html of the first (root) element in the collection of the JQx instance or set html for each element of the collection.
Overwrites current html of the elements, or appends (append: true) the value to it.
Note: htmlValue is always sanitized.
##EXAMPLECODE@htmlForEx##

instance_htmlFor.description:
Sets/adds/removes html for one or more elements (identified with a forQuery) within the element collection of the JQx Instance.
Notes:
  • html from htmlString is always sanitized.
  • if htmlString is empty, the element content is removed.
##EXAMPLECODE@htmlForEx##

instance_prepend.description:
Injects one or more elements at the start of each element of the collection of a JQx Instance.
The syntax equals
append
.
Notes:
  • When (one of) elems2Prepend is a collection of elements (e.g. retrieved from $(`.example`)), the elements from the collection will be prepended in reversed order.
  • When the JQx Instance to append to is empty, nothing will happen.
  • If (one of) elems2Prepend consists of html string(s), they should contain valid html (e.g., no flow content in elements expecting phrasing content, so for example no <h1> within <p>). The HTML is always sanitized.
  • When (one of) elems2Prepend, a textNode is prepended.
  • Already existing (in DOM) elems2Prepend are moved to the JQx instance when the JQx instance to prepend to has one element in its collection, but
  • elems2Prepend (if JQx instance or Node) are cloned and stripped of their id when the JQx instance collection to append to contains more then one element.
##EXAMPLECODE@prependEx##

params....elems2Prepend: string | HTMLElement | Text | Comment | JQx Instance (one or more)

instance_prop.description:
Set one or more properties (e.g. title or disabled) value for each element of the JQx Instance element collection. Or, without [value] retrieve the value of [property] of the first (root) element from the JQx Instance collection.
Notes:
  • Properties are validated (so, e.g. no onclick etc. - see example).
  • When the property is id, the id for the first element of the JQx instance collection will be set (duplicate id's are not allowed in html).
  • See all information on properties and attributes @javascript.info
##EXAMPLECODE@propEx##

instance_attr.description:
Get (keyOrObj string, [value] empty) attribute for the root element of the JQx Instance or set attributes for the first (root) element of the JQx Instance element collection.
Notes:
  • to set data-attribute or style, use {[data/style]: {[key]: [value], ...} (see example)
  • To set multiple class-names, use a comma or space separated string of class names
    (e.g. [instance].attr({class: `class1, class2, ... `}))
    Additional note: setting class using [JQx instance].attr will replace the existing class attribute. Use
    [JQx instance].addClass
    to add classes to an Element.
  • All attributes are validated (so, e.g. no onclick etc.)
  • Setting an attribute value ([keyOrObj] returns the JQx instance.
  • See all information on attributes and properties @javascript.info
##EXAMPLECODE@attrEx##

instance_addClass.description:
Add [classNames] to each element of the element collection of the JQx instance. ...classNames Can be one or more strings.
##EXAMPLECODE@addClassEx##

instance_About.description:
All methods applicable for an instance of JQx.
An instance of JQx is anything created with the imported JQx constructor (here $). A JQx instance is recognizable with a boolean property isJQx (for backward compatibility one can also use isJQL).
// in html use <script type="module"> import $ from "//kooiinc.github.io/JQx/Bundle/jqx.min.js"; // ^ or any location you downloaded the JQx library to </script>
As said, JQx can be used to retrieve, create, modify or manipulate (collections of) HTML elements.
The syntax [imported JQx constructor](input[, root, position]):
  • input: A (n Array of) HTML string(s), HTMLElement, JQx instance or a single (simple or complex) css selector.
    Notes:
    • When using an Array, its elements must be of equal types (so an Array of either Nodes (including text nodes), or HTML strings, or JQx instances).
    • For creating Text Nodes you can use either $("<text>some text") or $($.text("some text")). Both can also be Arrays.
    • For creating HTML Comment Nodes you can use either $("<!--[comment 1]-->") or $($.text("[comment 1]", true)). Both can also be Arrays.
  • root: (HTMLElement | JQx Instance) The root element for the [input]. Default is document.body. When root is a JQx Instance, the first element of its collection is presumed to be the root.
  • position: (string) For creation of elements: where the instance should end up (relative to the root). You can use:
    • "beforebegin": (before [root], so [root] will be the first sibling of [input])
    • "afterbegin": (after the begin of [root], so [input] as first element of [root])
    • "beforeend": (before the end of [root], so [input] as last element of [root]))
    • "afterend": (after [root], so [input] will be the first sibling of [root])
    You can also use
    the static [JQx].at property
    .
Every JQx Instance has a three relevant static properties:
  • collection: Array<HTMLelement>: an Array with the collection of elements contained in the instance (so, $(`.someClass`).collection can contain 0 to n elements)
  • isVirtual: boolean: true if the instance is virtual (i.e. not (yet) in the DOM-tree)
  • isJQx: boolean: true if the instance is a JQx instance (so $.nodes(`.someClass`).isJQx is false) -
    see [JQx].nodes
Examples:
  • const exampleDiv = $(`<div id="example">Hello <div class="example">world</div></div>`);
  • const exampleDiv = $(`<div id="example"> world</div>`, $.node(`.example:first-child`), "afterbegin");
  • const exampleDiv = $(`meta, style`, document.documentElement);
  • const exampleDiv = $([`<div class="a">A</div>`, `<div class="B">B</div>`]);
  • const exampleDivs = $(`.example`);
  • const exampleSubDivs = $(`#example`).find$(`.example`);
  • ... etc
Where a method's return value is JQx Instance, method chaining is possible.
##EXAMPLECODE@chainEx##
In the following every instance method is documented.

static_About.description:
Static methods are methods you can call using the imported JQx module.
For example, when imported as $, $.editCssRule(...) or const popup = $.Popup.

Direct element creation

For all allowed HTML elements (e.g. div, table, ul) JQx encapsulates static methods to create them, with their HTML tagname as method name. A direct tag creation method name can either be UPPERCASE or lowercase ($.SPAN(...) equals $.span(...))
For example $.P('Hello!') creates a JQx instance encapsulating a HTMLParagraphElement with content "Hello!".
Such HTML elements are created in memory, not yet added to the DOM.
The syntax for element creation follows the syntax from the tinyDOM library.
Examples:
  • $.P( 'Hello!' )
  • $.div( {class:"hello", id:"hi"}, 'Hello', $.span(' world!') )
  • $.img( {src: './images/someImg.png'} )
Autonomous custom elements (Web componenents) can also be adressed by using either $[`some-component`](...) or its camel cased tag name: $.someComponent. You'll have to allow using such tags first: see
[JQx instance].allowTag
The top line of this document is a web component (<copyright-slotted>)
##EXAMPLECODE@staticElemEx## ##EXAMPLECODE@staticElemEx2##

instance_setData.description:
Set data-attribute(s) for each element of the the JQx Instance element collection. The attributes must be key-value pairs.
See also:
data
.
##EXAMPLECODE@setDataEx##

instance_show.description:
Show each element of the element collection of the JQx instance.
Note: this will reset the display css property. For more granular showing/hiding elements, use your own css classes.
##EXAMPLECODE@showHideEx##

instance_single.description:
When indexOrSelector has a value, retrieves the first matching element from a JQx Instance collection, or retrieves the first (root) element from the collection. The result will be a new JQx Instance (note: its collection may be empty).
Note: retrieve a single element with a number is zero based.
##EXAMPLECODE@singleEx## ##EXAMPLECODE@singleEx2## ##EXAMPLECODE@singleEx3##

Aliases: first$ and nth$ ##EXAMPLECODE@first$Ex## ##EXAMPLECODE@nth$Ex##

params.indexOrSelector: string | number. An optional (valid) css selector.

instance_style.description:
Style each element of the of the JQx Instance element collection inline, so <div style="[the style from parameters]">. If keyOrKvPairs is a string and value is not empty, will set a single style value. Preferably use key-value pairs.
Note: using !important will be honored, e.g. {color: `green !important`}.
Equivalent to
[JQx instance].Style.inline

instance_toNodeList.description:
Copy the JQx Instance element collection into a NodeList. It may be a way to duplicate a collection of nodes (see example).
Notes:
  • the list is not a live NodeList. In other words: the nodes are copies of the original (and only exist in memory)
  • the eventual id of the copied nodes is removed (element id's must be unique). See also the .duplicate method
##EXAMPLECODE@toNodeListEx##

instance_trigger.description:
Trigger a handler for all elements of the the JQx Instance element collection.
Note: bubbling is always true ({bubbles: true}), because event handling in this library uses event delegation.
See the example @
the delegate documentation

params.SpecifiedEvent: Event. The event may be specified, e.g. MouseEvent. Defaults to generic Event

params.options: Object. Event options. Default {bubbles: true, cancelable: false, composed: false}

instance_toggleClass.description:
Toggle className (on/off) for each element of the JQx Instance element collection.
##EXAMPLECODE@toggleClassEx##

params.className: string. The class name to toggle (eg 'hidden')

instance_val.description:
Get or set the value of (the root element of) the JQx instance, where the first element is one of input, textarea or select HTMLElement.
When newValue is empty, return the current value, otherwise the JQx Instance. When newValue is not a string, the new value will be an empty string.
##EXAMPLECODE@valEx##

static_virtual.description:
Create a HTML element, but don't add it to DOM (so, only in memory).
##EXAMPLECODE@virtualEx##

params.html: string | string[]. A (n array of) (valid) html string

params.root: Node. The parent of the element to create

params.position: The position relative to the parent of the element to create

static_text.description:
Create a text (isComment: false) or comment (isComment: true) Node.
##EXAMPLECODE@textOrCommentEx##

params.str: string. The text content of the node

static_popup.description: Alias for [JQx].Popup. This is kept for backward compatibility. Note: it may disappear someday!

popup_About.description:
Popup is a small module for creating (modal) popups. By default it is not initialized. You can initialize it using the Popup getter: const popup = [JQx].Popup, or use it directly ([JQx].Popup.show(...)). Also available as [JQx].popup (deprectated, may disappear without notice)
Once initialized you can use the 4 methods the module contains, documented in the following.

popup_create.description:
Create a popup. When isModalOrCallback is a boolean and true, the window can not be automatically closed, use removeModal for that.
When isModalOrCallback is a function it will be called after the popup is closed. Other truthy values create a modal popup.
Note: [JQx].Popup.create is a legacy method. It is replaced with the more versatile (less convoluted)
show
method.
When modalCallback is a function, it will be called after a modal popup is closed.
The examples demonstrate both a modal popup and a regular one.
##EXAMPLECODE@popupCreateEx## ##EXAMPLECODE@popupCreateModalEx##

params.message: JQx instance | Node | HTML string | string

params.modalCallback: Function. Optional function to call after closing a modal popup.

params.modalWarning: Optional warning text when a user tries to close a modal popup without the preferred action.

popup_createTimed.description:
Create a (non modal) popup, that closes itself after closeAfter seconds.
##EXAMPLECODE@popupTimedEx##

params.message: string. A text or (valid) HTML string.

params.closeAfter: Number. The number of seconds after the popup closes itself. Default 2.

params.callback: Function. Optional function to call after closing the popup.

popup_removeModal.description:
Remove a modal popup. See the third example @
[JQx].Popup.show
.

static_log.description:
Equivalent to
log
in
debugLog
, but for intermediate logging to console (so debugLog doesn't have to be set to 'on').
While loading this document this logging was called several times. See the console for that.

static_nodes.description:
Retrieve or more DOM Nodes from [root]. The equivalent of Array.from([root].querySelectorAll([css selector])).
Note: returns a real Array (not a NodeList), so all Array methods work on the result.
For example: $.nodes(`.allGreen`).map(elem => elem.textContent += ` I'm green!`);.

static_node.description: Retrieve a DOM Node from [root]. The equivalent of [root].querySelector([css selector]). For example: const firstGreen = $.node(`.allGreen`);.

static_createStyle.description:
Alias of
editStylesheet
. This method is kept for backward compatibility. Note: it may disappear someday!

instance_prependTo.description:
Injects the current JQx Instance at the start of prependTo.
If prependTo is a HTML string, it is converted to a JQx Instance and thus validated.
The syntax equals
appendTo
.

debuglog_About.description:
To use extensive logging for debugging (or just follow the application flow) you can use a special object named debugLog. debugLog is a static property of the JQx module. Where a method returns debugLog (so itself) the result is chainable.
Logging by default is to the browser console, but you can also log to a specially created element within your document.
By default debug logging is not active.
See it in action in the JQx demonstration page (click 'Show logs').
Note: errors when creating elements are always logged to the browser console.
// JQx imported as $ const { debugLog } = $; if (!debugLog.isOn()) { debugLog .on() .toConsole.off() .log("We started logging to div#logBox, enjoy ..."); }
There are two extra properties in debugLog to note:
  • toConsole can be used to enable or disable logging to the browser console. Use toConsole.on() to enable, toConsole.off() to disable logging to the console.. By default logging to the console is enabled. If logging is not active, using toConsole.on/off will set the state for later usage.
  • reversed. By default logging (to screen) is from latest entry to the oldest. To log from first entry to the last you can use debugLog.reversed.on(), and vice versa use debugLog.reversed.off(). As with toConsole this is only useful if debug logging is active, and only if logging to console is off.

debuglog_isOn.description: Check if debug logging state is active.

debuglog_isVisible.description: When logging to screen is active, check if the special logging box is visible.

debuglog_on.description:
Activate debug logging. By default logs all to the browser console.
Use [JQx].debugLog.on().toConsole.off() to activate logging to screen.

debuglog_remove.description:
Removes and deactivates all logging. If applicable removes the log box from the DOM.
Note: reactivate debug logging with [JQx].debugLog.on().

debuglog_log.description:
Log one or more strings, either to the console or the DOM logging element. debugLog Must be on (so debugLog.isOn === true).
Note For custom log messages to the console (independent of debugLog.isOn) you can use the
static [JQx].log method
.

debuglog_hide.description: Hide the DOM log box, if applicable (not logging to console).

debuglog_show.description: Show the DOM log box, if applicable (not logging to console).

debuglog_clear.description: Remove all strings logged until now from DOM log box or browser console.

static_setStyle.description:
Alias of
editCssRule
. The method is kept for backward compatibility. Note: it may disappear someday!

static_removeCssRule.description:
Remove one or more css rules (e.g. .someclass:after) from the custom JQx stylesheet (<style id="JQxStylesheet">).
Notes:
  • [...rules] may also be a single comma delimited string of several css selectors
  • When a rule has several cssSelectors in one rule (e.g. .test1, test2 {...}, surround the rule to remove with exclamation marks: $.removeCssRule(`!.test1, test2!`)
  • The selector to remove should be exactly the selector you used to create it. So removal of .test1, test2 {...} will fail using $.removeCssRule(`!.test1,test2!`)
  • For clarity
    removeCssRules
    exists also. Both removeCssRule and removeCssRules work exactly the same.
##EXAMPLECODE@removeCssRuleEx##
Note: removeCssRule uses the repository LifeCSS

params....rules: string | string[]. One ore more css selectors.

static_editCssRule.description:
Formerly known as
setStyle
.
On importing, JQx creates a custom stylesheet in the header (<style id="JQxStylesheet">. Within this stylesheet you can create, remove and/or modify style rules using [jqx].editCssRule
You can use either real style rule string, or a selector and an Object defining the properties of that selector.
When a rule is valid and doesn't exist, it will be created. Existing rules are modified with the given parameters.
You can remove rule properties (e.g. color) or complete rules.
  • To remove one or more rule properties, use (for example) $.editCssRule(`#someDiv`, {removeProperties: {color: 1, border: 1}})
  • To completely remove a css rule, use (for example) $.editCssRule(`#someDiv`, {removeRule: 1}) OR use
    removeCssRule
##EXAMPLECODE@editCssRuleEx##
Note: editCssRule uses the repository LifeCSS

params.ruleOrSelector: string. A css selector (e.g. div[data-form]) or a css rule (e.g. .redBold {color: red; font-weight: bold;})

params.ruleObject: Object<string, string> optional. When [ruleOrSelector] is a css selector, an object with rule properties.

static_allowTag.description:
The creation of some html-tags are prohibited/not enabled by default (like <frameset>, or <script>). You can allow the creation of such tags using this static method.
Allowing a tagName also enables its use as a static JQx extension method. So
$.allowTag('template'); // this will create template#myTemplate and add it to the DOM tree $.TEMPLATE({id: "myTemplate", innerHTML: "..."}).render;
Notes
  • using allowTag may introduce security problems. Handle with care!
  • This method can also be used to allow custom element (web components) tags.
    The top bar of this documentation is a web component (<copyright-slotted>), created with es-webcomponent-factory

static_prohibitTag.description:
The creation of most html-tags is allowed by default. You can prohibit the creation of a tag using this the prohibitTag method, e.g. $.prohibitTag(`dialog`).
Prohibiting a tagName also disables its use as a static JQx extension method. So
$.prohibitTag('template'); // this will throw a TypeError (because the result of $.TEMPLATE_JQx(...) is undefined $.TEMPLATE_JQx({id: "myTemplate", innerHTML: "..."}).toDOM();

instance_length.description:
The number of elements within the JQx instance element collection.
##EXAMPLECODE@lenEx##

popup_show.description:
Create and display a popup 'window'. There is one parameter, which is an Object with the following properties.
  • content: (JQx instance | HTML string | string) the message to show;
  • [modal]: (Boolean) true makes the popup modal (a popup without a closer icon, which can only be closed using some handler withing its' content);
  • [closeAfter]: (Number) the number of seconds after which the popup closes itself (ignored when modal);
  • [callback]: (Function) a function that will be executed after closing the popup;
  • [warnMessage]: (JQx instance | HTML string | string) a warning shown when the user tries to close the modal popup (e.g. by clicking outside it).
The only property that should have a value is content.
The examples demonstrate a regular and modal popup.
##EXAMPLECODE@popupShowEx## ##EXAMPLECODE@popupShowTimedEx## ##EXAMPLECODE@popupShowModalEx##

instance_data.description:
Delivers a utility Object to manipulate data-attributes of the first element of the JQx instance collection.
Notes:
  • [JQx instance].data is a static property;
  • [JQx instance].data's methods are applied to the first element of the JQx instance collection;
  • The handling of casing for data-attributes is a bit weird and poorly documented imho. In html and css a data-attribute like helloWorld will show up as hello-world, for setting of/retrieval from the dataset it should be helloWorld. The methods of [JQx instance].data mitigate this (in other words: you can always use either camelCased or dashed notation data-attributes here). The example should demonstrate this;
  • The methods .set and .remove return the JQx instance (so, you can chain from them).
The available methods:
  • all: Retrieves all data-attribute values (e.g. [JQx instance].data.all.someattribute);
  • get(key: string[, whenUndefined: any]) Retrieves the value of data-attribute with [key] (e.g. [JQx instance].data.get("someattribute"). whenUndefined (optional) will be returned when the data-attribute does not exist);
  • set({key1: value1, ..., keyn: valuen}) Sets one or more attribute values (e.g. [JQx instance].data.set({someattribute: "1"}));
  • remove(key: string) Removes the data-attribute with [key] (e.g. [JQx instance].data.remove("someattribute")).
See also
getData
and
setData
.
##EXAMPLECODE@dataEx##

instance_HTML.description:
Returns a utility object for retrieving inner-/outerHTML, replacing, inserting or appending html of the first element of the JQx instance element.
The available methods:
  • get([outer:boolean, escaped:boolean]) Retrieves the html. If [outer] is true, it will be the outerHTML, otherwise innerHTML. When [escaped] is true, the html will be escaped, meaning that you can display the html within another html element.
  • set(content:string|JQx instance, [append:boolean], [escape:boolean]) Set the html of the first element of the JQx collection.
    • When [append] is true, [content] is appended to the existing html.
    • When[escape] is true, [content] is escaped (so: <div> becomes <div>)
    Notes:
    • [content] is always sanitized.
    • When not appended or inserted, set destroys everything within the first element of the JQx collection
  • replace(content:string|JQx Instance, [escape:boolean]) Replaces innerHTML with [content]. See HTML.set.
  • append(content:string|JQx Instance, [escape:boolean]) Appends [content] to innerHTML. See HTML.set.
  • insert(content:string|Node|JQx Instance, [escape:boolean]) Inserts [content] to innerHTML. See HTML.set.
Notes:
  • set, replace, append and insert return the JQx instance.
  • When the [html] parameter is a JQx Instance, the outer HTML of the first element of its collection will be used.
##EXAMPLECODE@htmlObjEx##

static_editCssRules.description:
Like editCssRule but for multiple css rules at once
Add one or more css rules (e.g. .redBold {color: red; font-weight: bold;}) to <style id="JQxStylesheet">.
##EXAMPLECODE@editCssRulesEx##
Note: editCssRules uses the repository LifeCSS

params....rules: string[]. One or more complete css rules

instance_Style.description:
Delivers a utility object to manipulate styling of a JQx instance (element collection) or retrieve computed style value(s) from the first element of the element collection.
The available methods:
  • inline(rules: Object<string, string>) set the styling of all elements of the JQx instance collection using the style attribute (style="...")
  • inSheet(rules: Object<string, string>) set the styling of all elements of the JQx instance collection using the JQx custom stylesheet. When rules contains a className property, the className and the rules values will be added to the styleSheet, otherwise a intermediate className will be created for the given rules (see the example)
  • byRule({classes2Apply: Array<string>, rules: Array<string>}) Add one or more rules to the JQx custom stylesheet and (optionally) apply one or more classes to the concerning JQx Instance. See second example.
  • nwRule(rule:string). Create a new rule with className (.someClass) or id (#someId) and add the class or id from the rule to the element this method is called from. See second example.
    Note: if the element already has an id, it is NOT overwritten!
  • computed (getter) Retrieves the complete computedStyle of the first element of the JQx instance collection.
  • valueOf(key:string) Retrieve the computed value of a style property (see example)
Notes:
  • inline, inSheet and byRule return the JQx instance.
  • For the [key] value of valueOf you can either supply camel cased or dashed notation (e.g. "borderLeft" vs "border-left")
##EXAMPLECODE@styleObjInStyleEx## ##EXAMPLECODE@styleRulingsEx##

static_fn.description:
Add custom method to JQx instances.
The first argument of function [fn] is the JQx instance. Calling the added method, you only need [...arguments]. See both examples for usage.
##EXAMPLECODE@fnEx## ##EXAMPLECODE@fnEx2##

instance_closest.description:
Return the parent element/node with css selector the closest (upwards) to the first element of the JQx instance collection. Equals Element.closest. The element returned is either new JQx instance (when something was found) or the original JQx instance (nothing found).
##EXAMPLECODE@closestEx##

static_IS.description:
[JQx].IS is a utility. With it you can determine if a given Object is of (one of) the shouldBe types, or determine what type obj is.
##EXAMPLECODE@ISEx##
There's an extensive example of this utility method in the demonstration page of the github repository 'typeOfAnything'.

instance_beforeMe.description:
Alias for
[JQx instance].before

instance_andThen.description:
.andThen injects [elem2Add] into the parent of the current JQx instance, right before (before = true) or after it. The original instance is replaced with an JQx instance containing both elements in its collection. The return value is the new instance.
##EXAMPLECODE@andThenEx##

params.elem2Add: JQx instance | single HtmlElement | HTML string

static_removeCssRules.description:
Remove one or several css rule(s) (e.g. .someclass:after) from the custom JQx stylesheet (<style id="JQxStylesheet">).
  • [...rules] may also be a single comma delimited string of several css selectors
  • When a rule has several cssSelectors in one rule (e.g. .test1, test2 {...}, surround the rule to remove with exclamation marks: $.removeCssRule(`!.test1, test2!`)
  • The selector(s) to remove should be exactly the selector you used to create it. So removal of .test1, test2 {...} will fail using $.removeCssRule(`!.test1,test2!`)
  • For clarity
    removeCssRule
    exists also. Both removeCssRule and removeCssRules work exactly the same.
##EXAMPLECODE@removeCssRulesEx##
Note: removeCssRules uses the repository LifeCSS

params....rules: string | string[]. One ore more css selectors

instance_replaceWith.description:
Replace the JQx Instance with a new JQx Instance.
Note: formerly known as replaceMe, which may still be used for now. replaceMe is candidate for future deprecation.
##EXAMPLECODE@replaceWithEx##

debuglog_reversed.description: By default logging starts with the oldest event logged. With This method on can reverse that to newest first. Use debugLog.reversed.on/off()

static_lenient.description:
A few HTML tags are prohibited (e.g. script). One can override it using $.lenient. It is an Object with two methods:
  • use $.lenient.on() to allow the creation of not allowed HTML tags (e.g. embed)
    Note: $.lenient.on() may introduce security problems. Handle with care!
  • (Default) use $.lenient.off() to use only permitted HTML tags.

By default prohibited HTML tags:

  • audio
  • embed
  • form
  • iframe
  • frameset
  • object
  • progress
  • script
  • template
To allow individual HTML tags, use
$.allowTag(tagName)
To prohibit individual HTML tags, use
$.prohibitTag(tagName)

static_at.description:
at is an Object containing eight properties to use for mapping a created elements' position relative to its parent, in other words: the position parameter from the JQx constructor.
For example:
$( "<div>Hi there</div>" /*[input]*/, $("#someElem") /*[root]*/, $.at.before)
Note: one can provide keys case insensitive. So $.at.afterend is equivalent to $.at.AfterEND.
Its keys (properties) are:
  • Before or BeforeBegin: before [root], so [root] will be the first sibling of [input]
  • Start or AfterBegin: after the begin of [root], so [input] as first element of [root] (de facto prepend)
  • End or BeforeEnd: before the end of [root], so [input] as last element of [root] (de facto append)
  • After or AfterEnd: after [root], so [input] will be the first sibling of [root]
##EXAMPLECODE@staticAtEx##

static_editStylesheet.description:
This factory function that creates (or retrieves) a stylesheet with the given id in the head of the document and returns a function to create/modify style rules in that stylesheet.
See also
the editCssRulesdocumentation
.
##EXAMPLECODE@staticCreateStyleEx##
Note: editStylesheet uses the repository LifeCSS

params.id: string. The id of the stylesheet to edit. If stylesheet#[id] does not exist, it will be created

static_Popup.description:
The built in Popup library.
See
the documentation
.

instance_after.description:
.after injects [elem2Add] into the parent of the current JQx instance, right after it. The original instance is replaced with an JQx instance containing both elements in its collection. The return value is the new instance.
##EXAMPLECODE@afterMeEx##

instance_before.description:
.beforeMe injects [elem2Add] into the parent of the current JQx instance, right before it. The original instance is replaced with an JQx instance containing both elements in its collection. The return value is the new instance.
##EXAMPLECODE@beforeMeEx##

params.indexOrSelector: string | number. An optional (valid) css selector.

instance_render.description:
[JQx instance].render is a property of a JQx instance. It writes the JQx instance to the document (appends the instance element(s) to the current document.body).
It is the equivalent of calling the
[instance].toDOM
function with default parameters.
##EXAMPLECODE@renderEx##

instance_renderTo.description:
renderTo writes the JQx instance to [root] at position [at]
It is the equivalent of calling the
[instance].toDOM
function with parameters.
##EXAMPLECODE@renderToEx##
